CI is green now. I'm merging it into master as a hotfix. And creating a issue to address duplicated profiles in spark/pom.xml and spark-dependencies/pom.xml
issue created https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-1303

@jongyoul: I have incorported all feedback:
1. Using ScheduledExecutorService for ensuring AppendOutputRunner is up, instead of doing so inside the while loop.
2. Synchronizing on the thread check and creation.
3. Removed all Thread.sleep() from unit tests except for one test "testClubbedData()" (which is basically a simulation of actual run). I am out of ideas for that one... Please advice.. We could remove that test as well..
@prabhjyotsingh I just updated screen-shot. Thank you for taking care of this.
@zjffdu master branch now fixes the CI problem. Could you rebase master and see how CI test goes?

CI is green.
Merge to master and branch-0.6 if there're no more discussions.

Thanks @khalidhuseynov for the fix. I tried this patch and it does not print stacktrace on PING message anymore when user not logged in.

However, it still prints stacktrace when user browse zeppelin gui. And i think it's also the case we don't need to print stacktrace.
Could you handle this case, too?

And IMO, i think it's okay to adjust log message level to DEBUG for both case because user browse Zeppelin gui without valid ticket is fairly normal behavior, when they're not logged in.

Thanks for the contribution.
Merge if there're no more discussions.

Thanks for the contribution.

Tested and it works great. 
Could you rebase and see if it passes CI?
Merge into master as a hotfix.

Thanks @mwkang for the contribution. Tested and it works well.

However, i'm not sure about passing informations like "isKeyEvent", "moveFocusToNextParagraph", etc, through `paragraph.config`.

`paragraph.config` map will be persisted and restored into note.json, and informations like "isKeyEvent", "moveFocusToNextParagraph" does not necessary to be persisted and restored.

Can we avoid passing those information through `paragraph.config`?

@prasadwagle Thanks for the fix!
LGTM. I don't think it's blocker for 0.6.1 release, but it will be nice if we can include it in 0.6.1 release.
LGTM.  Merging it into master if there're no further discussions.

how about "Add Spark packages support to Livy interpreter"?
@felixcheung done.
@Leemoonsoo  PR rebased.

@felixcheung Thank you for your review. 
I think The meta name of auto completion should be original meta name because the user interpreters name that you mentioned(spark1,spark2) is not related to meta name since the meta name comes from remote interpreter.
And If the meta name of spark is defined `spark`, auto completion meta name should be `spark` even if interpreter group name is `spark1 or spark2`.
What do you think?

@Leemoonsoo Yes, I agree with you.
I will change that. Thanks for review.
\cc @prabhjyotsingh

so This way(just spark) is clear i think.

@kavinkumarks Your changes LGTM, but could you please trigger the CI again?
Sure, let me take a look at it.

@jongyoul 

`caused by: com.datastax.driver.core.exceptions.NoHostAvailableException: All host(s) tried for query failed (tried: localhost/127.0.0.1:9107 (com.datastax.driver.core.exceptions.OperationTimedOutException: [localhost/127.0.0.1] Timed out waiting for server response))
`

The CI server is overloaded so the embedded Cassandra did not start in timely manner. Usually re-launching the test make it work
@doanduyhai Thanks for the quick response. I see what happened. Is there any way to avoid this failure by conservative code?

@jongyoul The only  way to avoid this failure is to block the unit tests until the embedded Cassandra server is up, which can take time and sometimes end in a dead-lock situation.

Another solution is to set a timeout for the embedded Cassandra server to start and skip all the unit tests in case of failure but I'm not fond of skipping tests because they are here to guarantee no regression

By the way, those issues are all related to the fact that we are running our software factory on a shared/mutualized infrastructure (Travis). I have the same issue of random failures due to resource starvation with my own personnal projects

@jongyoul I dont see the option to restart the build in travis since I don't have the write access to repo.And I didn't find any way other than doing some hacks.Could you please let me know how to do it?
@astroshim Can you create a JIRA issue for this, or point me to the existing one?
okay I'll make it.
